sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词都有"凋谢"之意。
means: fade ： 侧重指渐渐失去色彩和光泽。
wither ： 指因无活力而丧失生命力。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"消失"之意。
means: vanish ： 语气强，指完全、往往是神秘而突然的消失，不留任何蛛丝马迹。
disappear ： 普通用词，强调从视线或脑海中消失。这消失可能是暂时的、突然的或永久的，视上下文而定。
evaporate ： 指像水蒸发时那样悄然逝去，也指某人悄悄地、突然退出或离去。

sentence.Network_en: Sympathy for the rebels, the government claims, is beginning to fade.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府宣称，对叛乱分子的同情开始消退。

sentence.Network_en: He thought her campaign would probably fade out soon in any case.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为不管怎样，她的竞选活动都可能会很快归于沉寂。

sentence.Network_en: The colours gently fade each time you wash the shirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 衬衣每洗一次都会褪点色。

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause to appear or be heard gradually. Used of a cinematic or television image or of a sound.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 渐强：使逐渐出现或被听见。用于电影或电视的图象或声音

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause to disappear gradually. Used of a cinematic or television image or of a sound.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 渐弱：使逐渐消失。用于电影或电视的图象或声音

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'grow weak, waste away'; compare with fade away: from Old French fader, from fade 'dull, insipid', probably based on a blend of Latin fatuus 'silly, insipid' and vapidus 'vapid'

entry.def: When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.

example.ex: All colour fades — especially under the impact of direct sunlight...
example.tran: 所有颜色都会褪色——尤其是在阳光直射下。

example.ex: No matter how soft the light is, it still plays havoc, fading carpets and curtains in every room.
example.tran: 无论多么柔和的光线，也仍然会造成损害，会让所有房间的地毯和窗帘褪色。

entry.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(声音)逐渐减弱
entry.def: When light fades, it slowly becomes less bright. When a sound fades, it slowly becomes less loud.

example.ex: Seaton lay on his bed and gazed at the ceiling as the light faded...
example.tran: 光线渐渐暗了下去，西顿躺在床上，凝视着天花板。

example.ex: The sound of the last bomber's engines faded into the distance.
example.tran: 最后一架轰炸机的引擎声渐渐消失在远方。

entry.tran: (所注视之物)逐渐暗淡，逐渐模糊直至消失
entry.def: When something that you are looking at fades, it slowly becomes less bright or clear until it disappears.

example.ex: They observed the comet for 70 days before it faded from sight...
example.tran: 他们观察了这颗彗星 70 天，直至其慢慢从视线中消失。

example.ex: They watched the familiar mountains fade into the darkness.
example.tran: 他们看着熟悉的群山渐渐隐没到黑夜当中。

entry.tran: 变得不为人注意;变得无关紧要
entry.def: If someone or something fades, for example, into the background, they become hardly noticeable or very unimportant.

example.ex: She had a way of fading into the background when things got rough...
example.tran: 情况一有不妙，她总能退到幕后。

example.ex: The most prominent poets of the Victorian period had all but faded from the scene.
example.tran: 维多利亚时期最显赫的诗人差不多已全部湮没无声了。

entry.tran: (记忆)逐渐模糊;(感情)逐渐变淡;(可能性)逐渐变小
entry.def: If memories, feelings, or possibilities fade, they slowly become less intense or less strong.

example.ex: Sympathy for the rebels, the government claims, is beginning to fade...
example.tran: 政府宣称，对叛乱分子的同情开始消退。

example.ex: Prospects for peace had already started to fade.
example.tran: 和平的前景已经开始日渐暗淡。

entry.def: If someone's smile fades, they slowly stop smiling.

example.tran: 杰伊点点头，笑容慢慢隐去了。

entry.tran: 淡出;变得不再引人注目(直至完全消失)
entry.def: When something fades out, it slowly becomes less noticeable or less important until it disappears completely.

example.ex: He thought her campaign would probably fade out soon in any case.
example.tran: 他认为不管怎样，她的竞选活动都可能会很快归于沉寂。

entry.tran: (光线)逐渐暗淡;(画面)淡出; (声音)渐弱
entry.def: When light, an image, or a sound fades out, it disappears after gradually becoming weaker.

example.ex: You'll need to be able to project two images onto the screen as the new one fades in and the old image fades out.
example.tran: 你得能将两个图像投射到屏幕上，让新的渐渐淡入，旧的渐渐淡出。

means.word_mean: 1. a golf shot that curves to the right for a right-handed golfer;

sentences.sentence: "he took lessons to cure his slicing"

means.word_mean: 1. become less clearly visible or distinguishable; disappear gradually or seemingly;

sentences.sentence: "The tree trunks are melting into the forest at dusk"
"The prisoner has be languishing for years in the dungeon"

auth_sentence.content: Her time in the limelight was beginning to fade.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her time in the limelight was beginning to fade.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her time in the limelight was beginning to fade.

auth_sentence.content: One of those...women whose good looks fade almost overnight.
auth_sentence.res_content: One of those...women whose good looks fade almost overnight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One of those...women whose good looks fade almost overnight.

auth_sentence.content: These fade quickly, usually over a few months.
auth_sentence.res_content: These fade quickly, usually over a few months.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These fade quickly, usually over a few months.

Sentence.sentence: Tony Little, headmaster of Eton, warned that boys were being faded by the British education system because it had become too focused on girls.
They are expensive, and I've heard the printing fades easily when you wash them.
The printing on her T-shirt has faded.

sentences.en: Will the colour in this material fade?

sentences.cn: 国王的身体很快就衰弱了。

jushi.english: Those flowers in the vase have faded.

jushi.chinese: 国王的身体很快就衰弱了。
